definition[0]: the distance north or south of the equator (=the imaginary line around the middle of the world), measured in degrees
definition[1]: freedom to choose what you do or say
example[0]: Pupils enjoy considerable latitude in deciding what they want to study.
example[1]: Employees should have some latitude in organizing their work.
example[2]: The new guidelines give banks more latitude in making loans.
example[3]: States generally have wide latitude in setting tax policies.
